title: Worked Solution
text:
We can start by using the point-slope form of the equation, which is:

$$y$$ - y1 $$=$$ m(x - x1)

where $$m$$ is the slope and (x1,y1) is a point on the line. We are given that the slope is $$m$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{-1}{3}$$ and the point (x1,y1) $$=$$ $$(1, rac{1}{3})$$, so we can substitute these values:

$$y$$ - $$ rac{1}{3}$$ $$=$$ (-1/3)(x - 1)

Next, we can simplify and rearrange this equation to standard form, which is:

Ax + By $$=$$ C

where A, B, and C are integers and A is positive. To do this, we can distribute the $$ rac{-1}{3}$$ and move all the terms to one side:

$$y$$ - $$ rac{1}{3}$$ $$=$$ $$\left(- rac{1}{3}ight) x$$ + $$ rac{1}{3}$$
$$3y$$ - $$1$$ $$=$$ $$-x$$ + $$1$$
$$x$$ + $$3y$$ $$=$$ $$2$$

Therefore, the equation of the line in standard form is $$x$$ + $$3y$$ $$=$$ $$2$$.
